{"step_by_step_thinking": "To calculate the age of the fetus, we can use the crown-rump length (CRL) and foot length as indicators. The CRL is a measurement from the top of the head to the bottom of the buttocks, and it is a good indicator of fetal age. The foot length can also provide some information about fetal development. Additionally, the presence of the talus (a bone in the ankle) and the testes at the superficial inguinal ring can give us further clues about the stage of fetal development. Let's analyze the options based on these factors.", "answer_choice": "C. 7 months"}
